attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Now that the consequences of leaving the EU  are  more widely appreciated it is essential that a second vote is held so that people can make an informed decision about whether they want to remain part of Europe or not.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that leaving the European union would be an economic, political and social disaster.

attributes.action: Stop car Insurance Companies from increasing drivers for no fault accident claim
attributes.background: Make applying financial increases to driver insurance premiums who have been involved in an accident with a non-insured driver or in a no fault accident, illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unreasonable and unjust that drivers whom are unfortunate in being involved in a no fault accidents, or those involved in incidents whereby the other driver is not insured; should suffer a financial increase on their own insurance premiums. 

We pay a huge amount of money to the Insurance sector to protect us against incidents where our vehicles are stolen or damaged. At the moment a no fault accident will attract a minimum of a 10.81% load on your premiums, how is this fair or just?

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: Carrying defibrillators on trains could save lives. This should be made compulsory.

attributes.action: Make any overtime worked over standard contracted hours Tax free
attributes.background: I, like most, work hard as my wife does too over 50 hours per week often working Mon-Fri and then Sat and some times Sunday to earn extra cash to give our family a better standard of life and we are then taxed on the extra hours even after our standard normal weekly wage has been deducted
attributes.additional_details: This would be a massive benefit to lots of parents and families and encourage more people to do a bit more and get rewarded and then help the economy by spending that little bit extra!

attributes.action: Make recycling of all household low-grade plastics mandatory throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Household non-bottle low-grade plastics, including plastic pots, tubs and trays, are collected for recycling at the roadside in very few UK areas. It therefore goes to landfill. I call on the Government to introduce legislation ultimately leading to the mandatory recycling of all low-grade plastic.
attributes.additional_details: Global plastic use is out of control. We need urgently to reduce plastic waste and mitigate its devastating impact on the environment. A good place to start, and to set an example, is ensuring all household plastic is recycled in the UK. Recycling of plastic pots, tubs and trays (except for black plastic) was successfully introduced by Cornwall Council recently. In other UK areas, this plastic ends up in the general waste bin for landfill. We need to recycle all household plastic across the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the additional stamp duty for second home owners
attributes.background: The stamp duty on second homes is affecting the home owners market

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary for children
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Put a cap on the amount of hours an NHS employee can work in one shift.
attributes.background: NHS employees do life saving work. How can they successfully do their job whilst performing long shifts. There should be a cap appropriate so that they can continue to do their life saving work at a high level.

attributes.action: The undersigned demand the following terms are included in any UK Brexit deal.
attributes.background: To include a deduction for the value of the UK’s share of funds held by the European Investment bank, EU loans, EU properties, cash and any other EU investments and assets, the total of which will offset any financial payment(s) made to the EU in whatever form as part of our final Brexit agreement.

attributes.action: Death penalty for those found guilty of plotting or committing acts of terror
attributes.background:
Society is built entirely on trust. Trust between shop keeper and customer; trust between driver and passenger; trust between worker and employer.
Humanity has, over thousands of years, developed this system of trust so that we may live in peace, together.
There are few, seeking to destroy it.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Nitrogen Dioxide exposure by expanding the UKs sensor network
attributes.background: Levels of Nitrogen Dioxide across the UK are constantly over WHO limits, causing detrimental damage to our health. Awareness of high pollution areas is still low as the monitoring set up covers very few locations so people cannot take informed decisions to reduce their exposure.
attributes.additional_details: Exposure to any amount of nitrogen dioxide impacts our health and  our children's health.  Despite this there is limited coverage of the exposure we face in our daily lives.  There are few monitors and no public information showing pollution across our transport network, in schools, offices and levels inside vehicles. We therefore call upon the government to increase awareness of NO2 exposure by funding additional sensors and research into hotspots so information is available to the public.

attributes.action: Reduce Dartford crossing charges
attributes.background: Residents from Dartford and Thurrock  pay much reduced dart charge .  But people working on other side of the bridge pay a normal rate and even though you set yourself an online account - they still rip you off ! I spend ~£70 a month! Let's end this !

attributes.action: Stop MLM distributors selling health and weight loss products without training
attributes.background: Products like weight loss teas, meal replacements and other supplements are currently being sold by multi-level marketing distributors who aren't required to have any formal training in nutrition. They are giving advice that they aren't qualified to give and this is dangerous to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
Multi-level marketing distributors can mislead the general public with promises of fast weight loss and cures for ailments, without informing them of the risks to their health or the side effects. This ignores the duty of care which qualified individuals (dieticians) have to adhere to by law.

By forcing the MLM Company to educate the distributors, the duty of care is passed to the distributors who can be regulated to make sure the clients are assessed with proper screening.

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Use the Tampon Tax to subsidise sanitary products for girls of school age
attributes.background:
We believe the money gained through the tampon tax should be used for Period related issues.
Children of school age currently receive:
Free school meals
Free prescriptions
Free or subsided transport
Free contraception
We believe that sanitary wear should be added to this list.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39266056

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/girls-skipping-school-periods-cant-afford-tampons-sanitary-pads-a7629766.html

Periodicaldiary.com

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: HGVs to be restricted to the slow lane only on motorways and dual carriageways
attributes.background: Due to the increase in serious road traffic accidents cause by HGVs we would like to see HGVs restricted to the slow lane on motorways and dual carriageways

attributes.action: Create a devolved Yorkshire Assembly with powers equal to the Welsh Assembly
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to create a devolved legislative and executive body representing the traditional county of Yorkshire which will have powers equal to that of the Welsh Assembly, overseeing local matters such as housing; the environment; health services and flood defences.

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Refuse RSPCA entering homes/property to seize animals without permission/police.
attributes.background:
The RSPCA is seeking new powers in England and Wales to search some private property, including sheds and gardens, without a police warrant.
It also wants inspectors who have been invited to enter a home to be able to "seize animals in distress" without awaiting a police presence.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-40542246

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/rspca-government-powers-private-property-remove-pets-defra-england-wales-a7830176.html

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK
attributes.background: There is a legal loophole in the UK that allows the flag of Hezbollah, an organisation which hates the West, is anti-Semitic and perpetrates international acts of terror,to be flown in Britain because only Hezbollah’s military wing is proscribed by the Government but not its supposed political wing.
attributes.additional_details:
However, even Hezbollah’s own leadership does not differentiate between the two.  Speaking in October 2012, Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary General Naim Qassem stated: "We don't have a military wing and a political one; we don't have Hezbollah on one hand and the resistance party on the other."

This petition calls upon Home Secretary Amber Rudd to once and for all listen to Hezbollah themselves and proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK.

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children’s development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Scrap credit card age verification on pornographic sites
attributes.background: The approach to the UK Digital Economy Act Section 3 on Online Pornography which requires every pornographic site to have age verification by holding credit card information of users is completely misguided and shows ministers have a complete lack of understanding of how the internet works.
attributes.additional_details: This will lead to porn companies storing vast amounts of credit card information which could easily be subject to hacking. Porn sites wont necessarily have the proper security. VPN, Tor Browser, proxy search or a torrent make age verification pointless with easy work arounds. Tor Browsers could lead to young people accessing content that is banned/illegal in the UK such as rape & child pornography videos on the dark web. Fraudulent porn sites could also potentially steal credit card information.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: To retract the £1bn DUP deal and use the money across the whole United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party promised £1bn to Northern Ireland as part of a deal to secure a majority government with the Democratic Unionist Party. This deal should be suspended and the £1bn should be spent  across the whole of the UK, not to prop up a Parliamentary majority.

attributes.action: Keep Childcare Vouchers open beyond April 2018
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of parents will lose out under the new tax-free childcare. The voucher schemes should be kept open alongside tax-free childcare to give parents a genuine choice for the support that best suits their family.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare Vouchers have been used by millions and are currently used by 780,000 parents. The new Tax-Free Childcare (TFC) regime will extend childcare support to some people that cannot access the current voucher scheme and this should be welcomed. 
Government plans to close Childcare Vouchers to new entrants so hundreds of thousands of parents could lose out by £100s or find themselves unable to claim any support at all! Including couples with one working parent who won’t be eligible under TFC.

attributes.action: Give PCV licence holders category C1 licence aswell.
attributes.background: PCV holders or category D licence holders are able to drive any size bus e.g double deckers and bendy buses which can weigh in excess of 18 tonnes but cannot drive a vehicle which weighs less than half of this.
attributes.additional_details: Driving people around in a bus or coach is much more difficult than driving a small lorry half the size of the vehicles I can drive which weighs up to 7.5 tonnes. Even to drive certain vans which can weigh 4.2 tonnes cannot be done if classed as a normal van but if classed as a minibus it can be driven but the size is no different and neither are the tachograph laws.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Change the GCSE English Literature exam from closed book to open book.
attributes.background: Last year, lots of students struggled with GCSE English Literature as it was a closed book exam. Because of this many failed. How can they expect us to remember quotes from 15 poems, plus how to analyse them, plus remembering the whole plot, themes, characters and quotes from another book.
attributes.additional_details: Is it really fair that students have to remember so much, whilst also doing revision for other exams. It is important to know how to do all that is asked in the exams, but when in life will you ever have to remember lots of information about lots of texts, then be expected to recall it perfectly under pressured conditions, on top of loads of other stresses, then write about it for strangers to judge whether or not you are worthy of a good grade or not.

attributes.action: Make Emergency First Aid mandatory in schools
attributes.background: Unfortunately, far too many people wouldn't know what to do if they came across somebody in need of emergency treatment. From choking babies, bleeding or loss of consciousness, if people were given these skills while at school it would stay with them and could mean saving a life.
attributes.additional_details:
First Aid qualifications are valid for 3 years from the date of issue. 
If learning these vital skills while in school was mandatory, it could mean that one day your life could be saved by someone passing, simply because they had received the right training.

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.
